intro: Chlorophytum rutenbergianum, commonly known as the Rutenberg spider plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant features long, thin leaves that resemble spider legs, giving it its common name. It produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. This plant is relatively low maintenance and is often cultivated as a decorative houseplant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
